15#ifndef DNS_KEYTABLE_H
16#define DNS_KEYTABLE_H 1
17
18/*****
19 ***** Module Info
20 *****/
21
22/*! \file
23 * \brief
24 * The keytable module provides services for storing and retrieving DNSSEC
25 * trusted keys, as well as the ability to find the deepest matching key
26 * for a given domain name.
27 *
28 * MP:
29 *\li The module ensures appropriate synchronization of data structures it
30 * creates and manipulates.
31 *
32 * Resources:
33 *\li TBS
34 *
35 * Security:
36 *\li No anticipated impact.
37 */
38
39#include <stdbool.h>
40
41#include <isc/lang.h>
42#include <isc/magic.h>
43#include <isc/refcount.h>
44#include <isc/rwlock.h>
45#include <isc/stdtime.h>
46
47#include <dns/types.h>
48
49#include <dst/dst.h>
50
51ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
52
53isc_result_t
54dns_keytable_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_keytable_t **keytablep);
55/*%<
56 * Create a keytable.
57 *
58 * Requires:
59 *
60 *\li 'mctx' is a valid memory context.
61 *
62 *\li keytablep != NULL && *keytablep == NULL
63 *
64 * Ensures:
65 *
66 *\li On success, *keytablep is a valid, empty key table.
67 *
68 * Returns:
69 *
70 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
71 *
72 *\li Any other result indicates failure.
73 */
74
75
76void
77dns_keytable_attach(dns_keytable_t *source, dns_keytable_t **targetp);
78/*%<
79 * Attach *targetp to source.
80 *
81 * Requires:
82 *
83 *\li 'source' is a valid keytable.
84 *
85 *\li 'targetp' points to a NULL dns_keytable_t *.
86 *
87 * Ensures:
88 *
89 *\li *targetp is attached to source.
90 */
91
92void
93dns_keytable_detach(dns_keytable_t **keytablep);
94/*%<
95 * Detach *keytablep from its keytable.
96 *
97 * Requires:
98 *
99 *\li 'keytablep' points to a valid keytable.
100 *
101 * Ensures:
102 *
103 *\li *keytablep is NULL.
104 *
105 *\li If '*keytablep' is the last reference to the keytable,
106 * all resources used by the keytable will be freed
107 */
108
109isc_result_t
110dns_keytable_add(dns_keytable_t *keytable, bool managed,
111 bool initial, dst_key_t **keyp);
112/*%<
113 * Add '*keyp' to 'keytable' (using the name in '*keyp').
114 * The value of keynode->managed is set to 'managed', and the
115 * value of keynode->initial is set to 'initial'. (Note: 'initial'
116 * should only be used when adding managed-keys from configuration.
117 * This indicates the key is in "initializing" state, and has not yet
118 * been confirmed with a key refresh query. Once a key refresh query
119 * has validated, we update the keynode with inital == false.)
120 *
121 * Notes:
122 *
123 *\li Ownership of *keyp is transferred to the keytable.
124 *\li If the key already exists in the table, ISC_R_EXISTS is
125 * returned and the new key is freed.
126 *
127 * Requires:
128 *
129 *\li 'keytable' points to a valid keytable.
130 *
131 *\li if 'initial' is true then 'managed' must also be true.
132 *
133 *\li keyp != NULL && *keyp is a valid dst_key_t *.
134 *
135 * Ensures:
136 *
137 *\li On success, *keyp == NULL
138 *
139 * Returns:
140 *
141 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
142 *\li ISC_R_EXISTS
143 *
144 *\li Any other result indicates failure.
145 */
146
147isc_result_t
148dns_keytable_marksecure(dns_keytable_t *keytable, const dns_name_t *name);
149/*%<
150 * Add a null key to 'keytable' for name 'name'. This marks the
151 * name as a secure domain, but doesn't supply any key data to allow the
152 * domain to be validated. (Used when automated trust anchor management
153 * has gotten broken by a zone misconfiguration; for example, when the
154 * active key has been revoked but the stand-by key was still in its 30-day
155 * waiting period for validity.)
156 *
157 * Notes:
158 *
159 *\li If a key already exists in the table, ISC_R_EXISTS is
160 * returned and nothing is done.
161 *
162 * Requires:
163 *
164 *\li 'keytable' points to a valid keytable.
165 *
166 *\li keyp != NULL && *keyp is a valid dst_key_t *.
167 *
168 * Returns:
169 *
170 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
171 *\li ISC_R_EXISTS
172 *
173 *\li Any other result indicates failure.
174 */
175
176isc_result_t
177dns_keytable_delete(dns_keytable_t *keytable, const dns_name_t *keyname);
178/*%<
179 * Delete node(s) from 'keytable' matching name 'keyname'
180 *
181 * Requires:
182 *
183 *\li 'keytable' points to a valid keytable.
184 *
185 *\li 'name' is not NULL
186 *
187 * Returns:
188 *
189 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
190 *
191 *\li Any other result indicates failure.
192 */
193
194isc_result_t
195dns_keytable_deletekeynode(dns_keytable_t *keytable, dst_key_t *dstkey);
196/*%<
197 * Delete node(s) from 'keytable' containing copies of the key pointed
198 * to by 'dstkey'
199 *
200 * Requires:
201 *
202 *\li 'keytable' points to a valid keytable.
203 *\li 'dstkey' is not NULL
204 *
205 * Returns:
206 *
207 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
208 *
209 *\li Any other result indicates failure.
210 */
211
212isc_result_t
213dns_keytable_find(dns_keytable_t *keytable, const dns_name_t *keyname,
214 dns_keynode_t **keynodep);
215/*%<
216 * Search for the first instance of a key named 'name' in 'keytable',
217 * without regard to keyid and algorithm. Use dns_keytable_nextkeynode()
218 * to find subsequent instances.
219 *
220 * Requires:
221 *
222 *\li 'keytable' is a valid keytable.
223 *
224 *\li 'name' is a valid absolute name.
225 *
226 *\li keynodep != NULL && *keynodep == NULL
227 *
228 * Returns:
229 *
230 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
231 *\li ISC_R_NOTFOUND
232 *
233 *\li Any other result indicates an error.
234 */
235
236isc_result_t
237dns_keytable_nextkeynode(dns_keytable_t *keytable, dns_keynode_t *keynode,
238 dns_keynode_t **nextnodep);
239/*%<
240 * Return for the next key after 'keynode' in 'keytable', without regard to
241 * keyid and algorithm.
242 *
243 * Requires:
244 *
245 *\li 'keytable' is a valid keytable.
246 *
247 *\li 'keynode' is a valid keynode.
248 *
249 *\li nextnodep != NULL && *nextnodep == NULL
250 *
251 * Returns:
252 *
253 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
254 *\li ISC_R_NOTFOUND
255 *
256 *\li Any other result indicates an error.
257 */
258
259isc_result_t
260dns_keytable_findkeynode(dns_keytable_t *keytable, const dns_name_t *name,
261 dns_secalg_t algorithm, dns_keytag_t tag,
262 dns_keynode_t **keynodep);
263/*%<
264 * Search for a key named 'name', matching 'algorithm' and 'tag' in
265 * 'keytable'. This finds the first instance which matches. Use
266 * dns_keytable_findnextkeynode() to find other instances.
267 *
268 * Requires:
269 *
270 *\li 'keytable' is a valid keytable.
271 *
272 *\li 'name' is a valid absolute name.
273 *
274 *\li keynodep != NULL && *keynodep == NULL
275 *
276 * Returns:
277 *
278 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
279 *\li DNS_R_PARTIALMATCH the name existed in the keytable.
280 *\li ISC_R_NOTFOUND
281 *
282 *\li Any other result indicates an error.
283 */
284
285isc_result_t
286dns_keytable_findnextkeynode(dns_keytable_t *keytable, dns_keynode_t *keynode,
287 dns_keynode_t **nextnodep);
288/*%<
289 * Search for the next key with the same properties as 'keynode' in
290 * 'keytable' as found by dns_keytable_findkeynode().
291 *
292 * Requires:
293 *
294 *\li 'keytable' is a valid keytable.
295 *
296 *\li 'keynode' is a valid keynode.
297 *
298 *\li nextnodep != NULL && *nextnodep == NULL
299 *
300 * Returns:
301 *
302 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
303 *\li ISC_R_NOTFOUND
304 *
305 *\li Any other result indicates an error.
306 */
307
308isc_result_t
309dns_keytable_finddeepestmatch(dns_keytable_t *keytable, const dns_name_t *name,
310 dns_name_t *foundname);
311/*%<
312 * Search for the deepest match of 'name' in 'keytable'.
313 *
314 * Requires:
315 *
316 *\li 'keytable' is a valid keytable.
317 *
318 *\li 'name' is a valid absolute name.
319 *
320 *\li 'foundname' is a name with a dedicated buffer.
321 *
322 * Returns:
323 *
324 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
325 *\li ISC_R_NOTFOUND
326 *
327 *\li Any other result indicates an error.
328 */
329
330void
331dns_keytable_attachkeynode(dns_keytable_t *keytable, dns_keynode_t *source,
332 dns_keynode_t **target);
333/*%<
334 * Attach a keynode and and increment the active_nodes counter in a
335 * corresponding keytable.
336 *
337 * Requires:
338 *
339 *\li 'keytable' is a valid keytable.
340 *
341 *\li 'source' is a valid keynode.
342 *
343 *\li 'target' is not null and '*target' is null.
344 */
345
346void
347dns_keytable_detachkeynode(dns_keytable_t *keytable,
348 dns_keynode_t **keynodep);
349/*%<
350 * Give back a keynode found via dns_keytable_findkeynode().
351 *
352 * Requires:
353 *
354 *\li 'keytable' is a valid keytable.
355 *
356 *\li *keynodep is a valid keynode returned by a call to
357 * dns_keytable_findkeynode().
358 *
359 * Ensures:
360 *
361 *\li *keynodep == NULL
362 */
363
364isc_result_t
365dns_keytable_issecuredomain(dns_keytable_t *keytable, const dns_name_t *name,
366 dns_name_t *foundname, bool *wantdnssecp);
367/*%<
368 * Is 'name' at or beneath a trusted key?
369 *
370 * Requires:
371 *
372 *\li 'keytable' is a valid keytable.
373 *
374 *\li 'name' is a valid absolute name.
375 *
376 *\li 'foundanme' is NULL or is a pointer to an initialized dns_name_t
377 *
378 *\li '*wantsdnssecp' is a valid bool.
379
380 * Ensures:
381 *
382 *\li On success, *wantsdnssecp will be true if and only if 'name'
383 * is at or beneath a trusted key. If 'foundname' is not NULL, then
384 * it will be updated to contain the name of the closest enclosing
385 * trust anchor.
386 *
387 * Returns:
388 *
389 *\li ISC_R_SUCCESS
390 *
391 *\li Any other result is an error.
392 */
393
394isc_result_t
395dns_keytable_dump(dns_keytable_t *keytable, FILE *fp);
396/*%<
397 * Dump the keytable on fp.
398 */
399
400isc_result_t
401dns_keytable_totext(dns_keytable_t *keytable, isc_buffer_t **buf);
402/*%<
403 * Dump the keytable to buffer at 'buf'
404 */
405
406dst_key_t *
407dns_keynode_key(dns_keynode_t *keynode);
408/*%<
409 * Get the DST key associated with keynode.
410 */
411
412bool
413dns_keynode_managed(dns_keynode_t *keynode);
414/*%<
415 * Is this flagged as a managed key?
416 */
417
418bool
419dns_keynode_initial(dns_keynode_t *keynode);
420/*%<
421 * Is this flagged as an initializing key?
422 */
423
424void
425dns_keynode_trust(dns_keynode_t *keynode);
426/*%<
427 * Sets keynode->initial to false in order to mark the key as
428 * trusted: no longer an initializing key.
429 */
430
431isc_result_t
432dns_keynode_create(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_keynode_t **target);
433/*%<
434 * Allocate space for a keynode
435 */
436
437void
438dns_keynode_attach(dns_keynode_t *source, dns_keynode_t **target);
439/*%<
440 * Attach keynode 'source' to '*target'
441 */
442
443void
444dns_keynode_detach(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_keynode_t **target);
445/*%<
446 * Detach a single keynode, without touching any keynodes that
447 * may be pointed to by its 'next' pointer
448 */
449
450void
451dns_keynode_detachall(isc_mem_t *mctx, dns_keynode_t **target);
452/*%<
453 * Detach a keynode and all its succesors.
454 */
455
456isc_result_t
457dns_keytable_forall(dns_keytable_t *keytable,
458 void (*func)(dns_keytable_t *, dns_keynode_t *, void *),
459 void *arg);
460ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
461
462#endif /* DNS_KEYTABLE_H */
463
